news_header: Sydney beaches reopen after mysterious tar-like balls were found on shore.
news_text: Beaches in Sydney have reopened for swimming after being closed due to the appearance of mysterious black tar-like balls that raised health concerns. Tests revealed the balls are made of chemicals similar to those in cosmetics and cleaning products, but their origin remains unknown. Eight beaches, including the famous Bondi, were closed for a clean-up. New South Wales Environment Minister Penny Sharpe stated that investigations are ongoing to identify the source of the pollution. The maritime authority confirmed the balls are not highly toxic but advised against touching them. The Environment Protection Authority continues laboratory testing to determine their origin.
